Well I canâ€™t speak for everyone, but in my experience, hook up culture has taken over. Itâ€™s hard to avoid. My advice to you is have that ONE experience of losing your virginity and learning how to have sex as a special occasion. Something meaningful and fun with someone you know and/or care about. Itâ€™s the closest you can be emotionally and physically to another person. Enjoy that connection. Hookups are best for instant gratification when you feel loose and want to have fun without an attachment. The key is DO NOT expect a relationship to come out of it and be upfront and honest about your intentions always. No point in hurting someoneâ€™s feelings by lying and getting their hopes up then ghosting them so you can remain unattached. Same goes for you though, donâ€™t get attached if youâ€™re going to hook up. Its good to explore and learn and experience the body of another person, but you donâ€™t have to sleep with several people or lose your virginity just because everyone else has. I waited, then threw mine away and I regret it to this day. You have a lifetime of sexual experiences waiting, but you only lose your virginity once.

Itâ€™s absolutely OKAY to be a â€œnon hook upâ€ person!! I chose to lose my virginity in a hook up. Worst decision ever in my opinion, but other people like hooking up. The most important thing is it is YOUR choice. Just because people are sleeping around, doesnâ€™t mean you have to. You choose the time and who it will be with. Go with your gut. If you are ready and just want to get it over with, go for it, if not, itâ€™s okay to wait for that special person too! â˜ºï¸

It takes strength to get up in the morning. It takes determination to get ready to leave your home. It takes amazing motivation to retain a daily routine of school/work life, personal life, and upkeep with hobbies! It takes endless amounts of new perspectives, bravely facing new challenges, and accepting ourselves as we are day in and day out. And guess what? You ALL have done it again! Youâ€™ve made it another day. Youâ€™ve conquered another challenge! Lived another chapter in your lifeâ€™s story. Life isnâ€™t supposed to be easy. Where is the fun in that? I understand you. I see your feelings. Iâ€™ve felt them. Deeply. Sometimes, I still do. But I sit down and truly think about JUST the good experiences Iâ€™ve had in the last day, week, month, and year. I think about how Iâ€™ve achieved things the 10 year old me wouldâ€™ve never thought of. Iâ€™ve cried over things I miss from childhood. I am 25. I still remember being 21, in college, thinking school would never end. But four years later, Iâ€™ve had lots of adventures that were unexpected and both great and painful. Iâ€™ve lived 25 years so far, I want to be there for another 25, and then another 25 because itâ€™s scary, but Iâ€™m also curious to see who Iâ€™ll be and what I will do by the time Iâ€™m 50, 75, or even 100.

Again, I understand. I totally get it. Being alive can be very exhausting, irritating, and downright maddening. But I challenge you to pick up your feet, find new adventures and strive to make life interesting. And sure youâ€™ll get tired, life wonâ€™t make sense, and itâ€™s really scary to not know whatâ€™ll happen, but thatâ€™s also the best part.
